title: 107_hr1509
content: The Act titled "National Media Campaign to Prevent Underage Drinking Act of 2001" amends the Public Health Service Act to establish a national media campaign to prevent underage drinking under the Department of Health and Human Services, Office of Public Health and Science. The Act establishes a national media campaign to prevent underage drinking in the US, conducted by the Secretary through the Office of Public Health and Science. The campaign is based on scientific research on youth attitudes and underage drinking prevalence, as well as mass media prevention campaigns. The Secretary will supplement existing efforts to prevent underage drinking in the US and coordinate with various federal agencies and departments. The Secretary will use funds from various federal agencies for a national media campaign targeting specific geographic areas with prevention and treatment resources, ensuring messages are culturally competent and language-appropriate. The Secretary will allocate funds for a national media campaign targeting minority groups, focusing on advertising and authorized uses like campaign development, media purchase, talent payments, and production costs. Funds under subsection (e) can be used for various purposes such as media time purchase, talent reuse payments, advertising production costs, testing, and evaluation of advertising effectiveness, as well as negotiated fees for winning bidders on proposals issued by the Assistant Secretary for Health. Funds under subsection (e) can be used for partnerships with community, civic, and professional groups, government organizations, and entertainment industry collaborations for underage-drinking prevention messages in various media formats. The curr_chunk discusses prohibitions on the use of funds for certain purposes, such as supplanting community efforts, political activities, and featuring elected officials in media campaigns. The curr_chunk outlines restrictions on the use of funds for specific purposes, including partisan political activities, media campaigns featuring elected officials, and advertising with corporate logos. The curr_chunk outlines restrictions on the use of funds for advertising messages with company logos and requires non-Federal contributions for media time purchases. The Secretary must develop and submit a comprehensive strategy to Congress within 6 months. The Secretary must develop and submit a comprehensive strategy to Congress within 6 months, including the nature and extent of underage drinking, scientific basis, target audiences, goals, message points, campaign outline, evaluation plan, and costs. Annual reports on activities funded under subsection (e) must also be submitted to Congress. The Secretary must submit annual reports to Congress on activities funded under subsection (e) and provide progress reports on the national media campaign's measurable outcomes. The term 'underage drinking' is defined as any consumption of alcoholic beverages by individuals. The term 'underage drinking' is defined as any consumption of alcoholic beverages by individuals who have not reached the legal drinking age in their state. Funding for this initiative is authorized for fiscal years 2002 through 2007, with a limitation of $1,000,000 for comprehensive strategy activities.
